got a black screen only. When clicking on an area (like a camera), the (black) screen appears to go full screen. There is no control panel to add streams. My opinion, they started this but never finished. As other posts said "Blank Screen"  Don't bother to download. This item should be removed from this list.

Like reviewers before me, on launching the application I was presented with an unhelpful blank black screen.

Initially, I was prompted to join my peers and to promptly delete the application

However, the image on the software source site showed a configuration panel on the right of the screen so I decided to investigate before deleting.

Finally, clicking and dragging on the right hand margin 'pulled' the configuration panel into view. That is a well hidden secret - very poor coding practice

Clicking on the software Name at the bottom of the configuration panel took me straight to the repository on GitHub, where there was a wealth of information.

Again, this felt more like a computer game where one has to carefully hunt around for clues in order to find the treasure (instructions)

I was not able to test the function of the application since it appears to require cameras with a URL internet connection - which I don't yet have.

The software writer(s) need to revisit this code and make the interface far more user friendly with clearly signposted links to Configuration, Help, etc etc.

Please, never assume that because YOU (the author of this software) know how it works, everybody else will instantly understand it. They won't, - and didn't,  as is clearly seen from previous reviews.

Only two Stars given. There could have been more if the interface was more intuitive to someone who was seeing it for the very first time - and not have to spend time doing a search.

Perhaps this will help somebody else to provide a proper review of the software.

Thanks for reading this far.

I'm surprised that software authors still have the enthusiasm to continue creating FREE software in the face of such lazy, DUMBASS, 'click happy' kids complaining all the time.

By the way, I am NOT the author of the software!. I simply tried it out of curiosity.

description: I found the configuration menu thanks to some poster below. However I entered the dvr url and nothing happens. No configuration instructions. Nothing on github either. I think it is just spyware. It sucks that I HAVE to give it a star. It doesn't deserve even one.

For Users:
1. this app is in alpha stage, so dont expect much
2. to configure your cctv hover/click your mouse on the right side of the windows, there is a setting bar auto-hide that will pop out. i suggest pinned it
3. to connect your cctv click one of the black screen, then input the rtsp/mjpeg/etc.. stream into the setting bar.
4. dont give low star rating for _ALPHA_ stage app, it is not ready for general sage IMO. need help ask dev for it on github, dont leave it in the review.

For Dev:
beside your coding, your app need documentations.
otherwise, good work.
I'll help on it on github when im free.

description: No option to configure
i just dont get it, no way to configure

This software WORKS! You just have to make an EFFORT and LOOK. Read my previous reviews here. 

I have installed it on Ubuntu 18,04.  It works!

 If this software doesn't work on YOUR machine that is YOUR problem!  
	(1) Accept the fact that YOU have a configuration Problem! 
	(2) Deal with it!
	(3) Get over it!
	(4) Don't blame good software because YOU are too lazy to read reviews and investigate. That makes you a Dumb-Ass Idiot!
	(5) Don't be rude or scathing about software authors.  Would you still say those things to them in person Face to Face??  Don't hide behind a keyboard in order to be rude.

It seems that the world has a great many DUMB-ASS IDIOTS who expect everything to be offered to them on a plate, they are too damned lazy to read instructions and too ignorant to understand the simplest of statements.

For example, other software that is clearly and concisely described as coded to work in Terminal, has reviews from idiots complaining of "No Icon to click on" etc, and then are scathingly rude about the software, calling it "Rubbish" and "Garbage" etc.

These clowns are so full of their self- perceived importance that they do not even stop to consider if they themselves could be in the wrong. They are not even interested (or probably too lazy) to read other people's reviews to see if they could be wrong

Before I install new software (software which I have not seen or used before), I always read all the reviews first. Comments such as "Works in 18.04 but doesn't work in 20.10" are good, valid and useful constructive comments. If there is a web site or a location on Git Hub I look there for any additional information. 

If somebody has left a glowing review but I can't get the software to work I simply accept that my computer has a configuration glitch and start looking for it!

Finally. if ANYBODY leaves a review after this one stating "Blank Screen", "Doesn't Work", "Rubbish" etc etc etc., you will now know that they are an ignorant, lazy DUM-BASS!

Rant over :-)

description:
This is a great app, especially for being in early stages of development. All you need is a properly formed URL for the rstp stream you are looking to capture and it works perfectly. I recommend reviewing the documentation for the device you are attempting to connect to. Being based on ffmpeg, the command line options from the ffmpeg cli tool work and provide good flexibility 

I'm using an Amcrest 8 channel DVR home security system and the URL looks like this:

rtsp://[username]:[password]@[IP_address]:[port]/cam/realmonitor?channel=[channel_number]&subtype=1

Hope this helps someone trying to figure it out. I would give this 5 stars if it had some documentation or a help menu.
no no no no no.....

Menu OK, Users need understood their Cam/CCTVs' stream output format to config (not an easy job)

Seems the menu was improved and having a demo live cam displaying once install and run.

I am using Ubuntu 20.04 with 16:9 screen laptop.

Worked ok: 
rtmp://live.a71.ru/demo/0   #The Demo Cam
http://{CamIP}:{port}/mjpg/video.mjpg

Failed on:
http://{CamIP}/cgi-bin/camera
http://{CamIP}:{port}/webcapture.jpg?command=snap&channel=1
summary: Menu OK, Users need understood their Cam to config (not easy)

description:
Thank you! This was exactly what I needed. There are loads of ip camera recording apps, but in my experience they are not able to load hd streams. This app shows hd streams for all my cameras, and greatly enjoy simplicity.
Anyone giving this app a low score was either;looking for additional features (recording, motion detection, etc.) which is clearly outside the purpose of this app, or, dont understand the often confusing world of IP cameras. Once you have all the required camera information, the app works flawlessly. Thanks Evgeny!

Thank you for this after Adobe have shut down flash, been looking for something and this little gem came up . VLC could not handle the speed and was buffering. THIS IS PERFECT ... Like the other comments you need to be able to configure the address of the camera and away you go.
Mine was 
rtsp://username:password@ip address:554/11
This opened up my CCTV and doesnt buffer at all . Thank you very much to the developer .. Great Stuff
how to use this app
Many thanks, just what I needed for live view of a HIKVision system! Works as expected, one thing for a futuire release; the processor load is on the hiogh side.

This app is perfetly formulated for viewing IP cams. Like with Goldilocks it's not too much or too little but "just right". My greatest obstacle was to determine the correct line to place into the first field of the Viewport. The web interface for my camera revealed this data. For my situation the second field of the Viewport appears to be entirely superfulous? Subjectively speaking, the app seems to load more quickly and stays connected to the camera more relaibly than other/previous apps. Very nice. Thank you Evgeny.

Very easy and intuative to setup. Simply click the square then in the sidebar enter the rtsp url in the viewbox. Grid layout can be completely customised by clicking and holding in the side bar and entering any row and columns you like, e.g. 6x8. You can also merge cells to make complex layouts. I have 7 cameras, 3 are displayed small and 4 displayed large. Excellent low latency which is a must in these types of applications. Able to add custom ffmpeg options which is great.

Thank you for making this available.

only one word to describe... USELESS
Completely useless
You should tell us how to add cameras, explain everything and all.
This app is very bad and USELESS.

Those people who are saying it is not working have no idea how to configure it. You need to go to your camera system and enable RTSP and get the url, this is for my REOLINK camera system, rtsp://username:password@192.168.1.343:554/h264Preview_01_main Now go to the app and paste the url in Viewport and in the URL field. Same with other camera urls, like Preview_02_main and so on. It works great.
i have 4x RTSP camera feeds and it works, i wish it was able to stretch some of the 4:3 feeds into 16:9. Needs option to save/export settings. Other than that it does what i want it to.

description:
August 2022. 
Not sure what problems others are having, it didn't take me long to get my RTSP streams up and running from my reolink cameras. Saved me a bunch of effort not having to figuring out my own custom solution!
no encontre forma de agregar camaras o dvr, no me funciono

Quick install. Took 5 mins to work out where I needed to enter information and another 10 minutes to write a list of streams, I wanted, and enter them in the app.
Potentially saves a lot of time checking systems as I have them in presets and don't need to load specific software.
Mainstream glitchy, sub streams fine. Probably need to figure a few more settings to be spot on.

thx,works perfect for hikvision cameras. you can add your hikvision camera using this link : rtsp://user:pass@192.168.0.101:554/Streaming/Channels/101/ . so just change user with your user,pass with your passworld ,and 101 is first camera,201 for second camera,301,401 etc...
Nice app! Easy to use, just add cam url and go! Thanks!
summary: Good works! Just add cam url

description:
Recently updated my old laptop with an ssd and 4 gb memory, runs Ubuntu just fine, and then I discovered cctv-viewer! I have 6 cams working fine! You do need to know the port/address of your webcams to add to the "viewport" .  Click on a viewport on the left, then on the right, add the info for that viewport and avformat options you want to use. You will need to inspect the web page of your dvr to find the correct path for the webcams, or do an internet search.
 I use rtsp for wired cams (I dont have ip cams!). e.g. - For ViewPort 1
rtsp://MyUserName:MyPassWord@my.ip.addr.num:MyPortNum/Streaming/Channels/101

Avformat options used: analyzeduration 0 -fflags nobuffer -flags low_delay -probesize 50000

Just hover over the settings to get a popup hint. The app could do with proper help file or setup help with examples.
Note that it does take a few seconds for the streams to load, but after that, all good!
summary: Recommend - works on old laptop running Ubuntu 22.04!
